text: Veliky Novgorod () is a city in the European part of Russia. It is the administrative center of Novgorod Oblast. It is about from St. Petersburg. In 2007, about 217,000 people lived there. "Novgorod" is the Russian word for "new city" and "Veliky" means "the Great". The city is actually one of the most historic in Russia. Its past can be traced to the 9th century. Yaroslav the Wise ruled there in the 11th century. It was the only Russian province that was not captured by the Golden Horde. Category:Capitals of oblasts of Russia
title: Veliky Novgorod
